entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. He is described as saying 'I think that will do for tonight' and 'Very important, I think'. (Excerpt: 'I think that will do for toni ght, Harry ,’ said Dumbledore')

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. He is described as responding to Dumbledore's statements with 'Yes, sir' and asking questions about Voldemort's past. (Excerpt: ‘Yes, sir,’ said Harry .)

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is a dark wizard who has a significant role in the story. He is mentioned by Dumbledore as having a 'past' that is important to know about. (Excerpt: ‘Sir ... is it important to kn ow all this about Voldemort’s past?’)

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is Harry's friend and a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. He is mentioned by Harry as someone he wants to tell about Dumbledore's statements. (Excerpt: ‘Sir, am I allowed to tell Ron and Hermione everything you’ve told me?’)

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is Harry's friend and a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. She is mentioned by Harry as someone he wants to tell about Dumbledore's statements. (Excerpt: ‘Sir, am I allowed to tell Ron and Hermione everything you’ve told me?’)

relationships.description: Dumbledore tells Harry about Voldemort's past. (Excerpt: 'I think that will do for toni ght, Harry ,’ said Dumbledore)
Dumbledore talks about Voldemort's past and its importance. (Excerpt: ‘Sir ... is it important to kn ow all this about Voldemort’s past?’)
Harry has a friend named Ron. (Excerpt: ‘Sir, am I allowed to tell Ron and Hermione everything you’ve told me?’)
Harry has a friend named Hermione. (Excerpt: ‘Sir, am I allowed to tell Ron and Hermione everything you’ve told me?’)
Dumbledore talks about Voldemort's past and its importance. (Excerpt: ‘It has everything to do with the prophecy .’)
